name: Together Again (The Doodle People, avikchari)
description:
Play as a floating teddy bear head. Explore mazes, avoid terrible monsters and regain your lost limbs. Once you've assembled your body? Can you find your heart?

Gameplay Exploration

Together Again explores the notion of monsters in games as "the other", as villians or agents of pain and harm. In this game, the monsters who tear your limbs and block you from being complete are later revealed to be your friends and family who are desperately trying to mend a broken version of yourself (and who is resistant to their help). Metaphorically, you've ripped their bodies and pieced yourself together...through their sacrifice and love.

Only once you're whole can you see what others have sacrificed for you...so that you may once again live whole. That sacrificial love becomes your heart. Finally, you've renewed yourself...but at what cost?

How to Play

Game is fully playable from start to finish. 

Possible edge case bugs here and there as expected for Game Jam games. No crashes reported so far.  

Controls:

WASD to Move

LEFT Mouse Button to Attack 

RIGHT Mouse Button to Roll / Evade

Theme Summary

Theme 

Renewal

What were you inspired by?

We were thinking through the horror of loss and the perceived monstrosity of emotions.

What sort of experience / message are you hoping your game will bring across to the player?

The difficulty in any process of grieving, and the support one might give or receive on such a journey.  

 Why did you end up choosing this direction for your game?

(Halloween + Cute) / Covid Inspired Theme
